column2: As an Administrative Assistant you will be responsible for providing executive level of support for senior management team members. This individual will manage all administrative functions such as preparing written correspondence, meeting with visitors/clients, scheduling conference calls, meetings, and all other administrative functions as assigned. Strong communication and organizational skills are essential for this position. Must be able to work under short timelines and multitask while maintaining a positive attitude. Admin will be responsible for the flow of communication between clients and Executives and prepare written correspondence, communications, presentations, and other documents as assigned. This person will manage multiple priorities and coordinate activities with other assistants within and outside the business channel when needed. Job Description Essential Job Functions Support each assigned department Senior Executive Answer and manage incoming calls and emails Manage and arrange executives calendars and travel schedules Review and submit executives??expense reports Regularly communicate with clients and company departments via email and phone Review incoming memos, submissions, and reports in order to determine their significance and plan their distribution per request Help work with multiple departments to coordinate client RFP/RFI?? responses when needed Help coordinate and manage Due Diligence/Client onsite and offsite visits Help coordinate conferences by handling department costs, registrations, client meetings, schedules, agendas, meeting space, etc. Research, assemble, and analyze data to prepare/print reports, documents, and presentations Provide assistance with internal projects when needed and be motivated to help Education/Experience Requirements Graduation from a 4-year college or university with major course work in a discipline related to the requirements of the position is preferred. Will consider the equivalent combination of job experience & education that demonstrates the ability to perform the essential functions of this job. List any special certifications, licenses, and/or knowledge requirements for this job: Proficiency in Excel, Word, and PowerPoint Proficiency in Lotus Notes Tools preferred Excellent communication skills How many years of directly related job experience are required to be qualified to enter the job? 1 year minimum Administrative experience; 2+ years preferred Experience in a mortgage banking / investment environment preferred

column2: Do you thrive on organization, have a hawk-eye for detail, and enjoy keeping teams on track? Are you passionate about legal operations and streamlining processes?  If so, we're looking for you! Our Law Firm at Santacruz West  is seeking a highly motivated and organized  Executive Secretary  to join our dynamic team. In this role, you'll play a vital part in ensuring the smooth operation of our legal practice by managing our administrative and Executive Tasks, and keeping our team accountable. Responsibilities: Daily Follow-up:  Proactively follow up with team members on tasks and deadlines, ensuring timely completion. Drafting of letters and notices. Preparing documents for Registration, and interacting with Registration office. Reading and Replying to emails. Case Progress Tracking:  Monitor case progress, identify potential bottlenecks, and escalate issues as needed. Compliance Champion:  Encourage and ensure all team members update and fill in their tasks within the workflow app. Process Improvement:  Analyze workflow data and propose improvements to enhance efficiency and productivity. Communication Hub:  Facilitate communication between team members and departments regarding tasks and deadlines. column2: Executive Assistant To Director   Position Overview:  We are seeking a highly organized and detail-oriented Executive Assistant to support the Director of Real Estate in managing a wide range of responsibilities within our dynamic real estate department. The ideal candidate will have strong administrative skills, exceptional communication abilities, and a keen understanding of the real estate industry. Responsibilities:  Calendar Management:  Effectively manage and prioritize the Director's calendar, ensuring optimal use of time and scheduling of appointments, meetings, and events. Coordinate and schedule property tours, inspections, and other real estate-related activities. Communication and Correspondence:  Serve as the primary point of contact for internal and external stakeholders, including clients, investors, and team members. Draft and proofread emails, reports, presentations, and other documents on behalf of the Director. Travel Coordination:  Arrange travel logistics, including flights, accommodations, and transportation, for business-related trips. Prepare detailed itineraries and ensure all travel arrangements align with the Director's schedule. Meeting Support:  Organize and prepare materials for meetings, conferences, and presentations. Attend meetings, take minutes, and follow up on action items to ensure timely execution. Document Management:  Maintain organized and up-to-date files, contracts, and documentation related to real estate transactions. Assist in the preparation of legal documents, contracts, and agreements as needed. Research and Analysis:  Conduct market research and analysis to provide relevant information for real estate decision-making. Compile data and generate reports on market trends, property values, and competitor activities. Administrative Support:  Handle general administrative tasks, including phone calls, expense tracking, and office supply management. Collaborate with other administrative staff to ensure efficient office operations. Qualifications:  Proven experience as an Executive Assistant or similar role, preferably in the real estate industry. Strong knowledge of real estate terminology, processes, and industry best practices. Excellent organizational and time management skills with the ability to prioritize tasks. Exceptional communication skills, both written and verbal. Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite and other relevant software. Discretion and confidentiality in handling sensitive information. Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment. Attending incoming calls with proper etiquette and maintaining records for them. Responding the telephonic call and carry out the conversations politely and timely manner. Coordinating meetings and appointments . Processing of requests:  ??Answers to internal/external requests in a timely manner, while respecting the Groups values so as to ensure a positive image of the Group/Entity.  ??Manages priority, tackles emergencies while being very attentive to impacts and potential tensions to mitigate.  ??Anticipates needs/requests so as to contribute to the Groups/Entitys performance. Management of files:   ??Collects pertinent information from the Entitys teams, internal partners and any other useful source so as to prepare all the elements necessary to the activity of his/her Manager.  ??Manages specific issues, in compliance with the Manager.  ??Completes purchases and ensures by delegation a role of validation (Optional) in various fields (purchase tools/billings, travel, etc.)  ??Monitors the Entitys budget. (Optional) Animation of its assistants network:  ??Collects and disseminates all necessary information to the activity of the assistants of the Management team (and even wider, to the executive assistant network).  ??Organizes and conducts meetings for exchange and regular points with his/her assistants team.  ??Ensures the hierarchical or functional management of the assistants within his/her network. (Optional)    Interested candidates can share their CVs on deeksha.ka@peoplefy.com

column2: **Position Overview:** The Executive Assistant (EA) for Real Estate will provide high-level administrative support to executives and teams within the real estate department. This role requires exceptional organizational skills, attention to detail, and the ability to handle confidential information with discretion. The EA will assist in coordinating meetings, managing schedules, preparing documents, and facilitating communication between internal and external stakeholders. **Responsibilities:** 1. **Administrative Support:** - Manage executives' calendars, schedule appointments, and coordinate meetings and events. - Prepare and distribute correspondence, memos, reports, and presentations. - Maintain and organize files, records, and documentation related to real estate transactions and projects. - Handle incoming calls, emails, and other communications, prioritizing and responding as appropriate. 2. **Document Preparation and Review:** - Assist in drafting and editing real estate agreements, contracts, leases, and other legal documents. - Review documents for accuracy, completeness, and compliance with legal and regulatory requirements. - Coordinate the execution and distribution of documents, ensuring timely completion of tasks. 3. **Project Coordination:** - Support real estate projects from inception to completion, liaising with internal teams, external vendors, and clients as needed. - Track project timelines, milestones, and deliverables, providing regular updates to stakeholders. - Assist in budget management and expense tracking for real estate initiatives. 4. **Communication and Liaison:** - Serve as a point of contact for internal and external stakeholders, including clients, investors, and vendors. - Facilitate communication between executives, teams, and external parties, ensuring timely and accurate exchange of information. - Coordinate travel arrangements and accommodations for executives and team members as required. 5. **Research and Analysis:** - Conduct research on real estate market trends, property listings, and industry developments. - Compile data and prepare reports, summaries, and presentations for decision-making purposes. - Provide analytical support for evaluating potential investment opportunities and assessing market risks. **Qualifications:** - Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Real Estate, or related field preferred. - Proven experience as an executive assistant or administrative support role, preferably in the real estate industry. - Strong proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) and real estate software applications. - Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with a professional demeanor. - Ability to multitask, prioritize tasks, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment. - Discretion and confidentiality when handling sensitive information and business matters. - Knowledge of real estate terminology, legal procedures, and contract management principles is desirable. The Executive Assistant for Real Estate plays a pivotal role in ensuring the efficient operation of the real estate department and contributes to the overall success of the organization.   "We highly value candidates who can join immediately and possess knowledge of real estate. Please send your updated resume to HR@jaygee.co.in. Your expertise in real estate will be considered an advantage."

column2: Groww is seeking a highly motivated and experienced Senior Administrative Executive on Contractual basis to join our team in Bangalore. The Senior Administrative Executive will play a crucial role in ensuring the smooth and efficient operation of our office by overseeing administrative tasks, managing office facilities, and providing support to various departments. The ideal candidate will have excellent organizational and communication skills, as well as a proactive approach to problem-solving.              Responsibilities:        1. Manage various facility services including reception, security, pantry, cleaning, and maintenance tasks.      2. Evaluate the performance of support staff and offer coaching to enhance effectiveness.      3. Recruit, train, and assign duties to personnel while organizing office space allocation.      4. Oversee attendance and payroll processing for housekeeping staff, pantry assistants, and security personnel.      5. Ensure equipment and supplies are well-maintained to meet safety standards.      6. Strategize administrative procedures and systems to streamline operations.      7. Coordinate installations and refurbishments including telecommunications, broadband, HVAC, etc.      8. Review utility consumption to minimize expenses.      9. Monitor office supply inventory and procure new materials within budget limits.      10. Track costs and expenses to aid in budget preparation.      11. Enforce adherence to policies and regulations within administrative operations.      12. Manage parking allocation, waste disposal, and office space distribution according to requirements.      13. Coordinate CCTV, Access Control, and Fire Alarm systems with building management.      14. Oversee all movements involving office staff, assets, and document management.      15. Support Admin Manager in organizing events, office gatherings, and visits by dignitaries and clients.      16. Assist in generating regular administrative reports.      17. Establish and maintain a filing system (both online and offline) for administrative and office documents.      18. Ensure compliance with office policies, budgets, and procedures. 19. Monitor and update office budget utilization.      20. Supervise various office activities such as recycling, renovations, and event planning.      21. Maintain high service standards, striving to exceed customer expectations and encourage retention.              Requirements:        Graduate / Post Graduate (B Com, BHM, BBA, BBM, BA, B.Sc, MBA/ PGDM etc).      5+ years of experience in office administration or administrative support role.      Hindi and English speaking is a must.      Basic understanding of Finance and Google Suite.      Proven ability to multitask and prioritize tasks in a fast-paced environment.      Strong organizational skills and attention to detail

column2: The Executive Assistant to the Managing Director (MD) plays a critical role in providing high-level administrative and organisational support to the MD. This position requires exceptional attention to detail, strong communication skills, and the ability to handle confidential information with the utmost discretion. The Executive Assistant will be responsible for coordinating and managing the MDs schedule, handling communications, preparing reports, and assisting in various executive tasks. This position requires a proactive, efficient, and adaptable individual who can work effectively in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.             Key Responsibilities:                 Calendar Management:       Manage the MDs daily calendar, including scheduling and coordinating appointments, meetings, and conferences. Ensure the MDs time is optimised efficiently             Communication:       Act as the primary point of contact for internal and external stakeholders, handling all incoming and outgoing communications, including emails, phone calls, and letters. Respond to inquiries promptly and professionally             Travel Arrangements:       Coordinate all travel arrangements for the MD, including flight bookings, hotel accommodations, transportation, and travel itineraries             Document Preparation:       Assist in the preparation of documents, presentations, and reports for internal and external meetings. Proofread and edit materials to maintain accuracy and consistency             Meeting Support:       Prepare agendas, take meeting minutes, and distribute materials for meetings attended by the MD. Follow up on action items and ensure timely completion             Data Management:       Organize and maintain records, files, and documents related to the MDs activities. Ensure all information is up-to-date and easily accessible             Project Coordination:       Support the MD in various projects, coordinating activities, and ensuring deadlines are met. Collaborate with other departments as needed             Event Planning:       Assist in organizing company events, conferences, and special occasions, both internal and external, as directed by the MD             Confidentiality:        Maintain strict confidentiality of sensitive information and exercise discretion in handling confidential matters             Administrative Support:       Provide general administrative support to the MD, including expense management, invoicing, and other ad-hoc tasks as required                     Qualifications and Requirements:                       Bachelors degree or Master s degree equivalent work experience         Proven experience as an Executive Assistant, Executive Associate, or similar role supporting top-level executives         Excellent organizational and time management skills, with the ability to multitask and prioritize effectively         Strong verbal and written communication skills, including exceptional grammar and spelling         Proficiency in MS Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) and other relevant software         Detail-oriented with a high level of accuracy in work output.         Ability to work independently, anticipate needs, and make decisions in the absence of specific instructions         Demonstrated professionalism, poise, and ability to maintain composure under pressure         Ability to build and maintain relationships with board members, business partners and other stakeholders         Flexibility to work outside regular business hours when necessary         Experience in handling sensitive and confidential information with discretion and confidentiality

column2: Position Overview: We are currently seeking a skilled Lab Admin Executive with expertise in diamond weighing and cleaning to join our team. The Lab Admin Executive will be responsible for accurately weighing diamonds and ensuring they are cleaned to perfection, adhering to industry standards and client specifications. Key Responsibilities: 1. Conduct precise weighing of diamonds using calibrated scales and equipment, ensuring accuracy and consistency. 2. Clean diamonds using appropriate techniques and solutions to remove dirt, oil, and other impurities. 3. Inspect diamonds for cleanliness and quality, identifying any imperfections or irregularities that may require further attention. 4. Collaborate with team members to prioritize tasks and meet production deadlines, ensuring timely delivery of certified diamonds to clients. 5. Assist in inventory management and record-keeping related to weighed and cleaned diamonds, maintaining accurate documentation. 6. Should be flexible to Multi-task in all Admin related tasks. Qualifications: 1. Strong attention to detail and accuracy, with the ability to maintain consistency in weighing and cleaning procedures. 2. Excellent organizational and time management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks and work efficiently in a fast-paced environment. 3. Strong communication and teamwork skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with colleagues and provide support as needed. 4. Commitment to upholding quality standards and ensuring customer satisfaction with every diamond processed. 5. Adherence to safety protocols and best practices for handling diamonds and operating cleaning equipment.

column2: We are seeking a highly organized and proactive Executive Assistant (EA) to provide comprehensive administrative support to our Managing Director (MD). The ideal candidate will possess exceptional communication skills, keen attention to detail, and the ability to manage multiple tasks efficiently.  The primary responsibility of this role is to facilitate smooth operations within the executive office, act as a liaison between the MD and Heads of Departments (HODs), and ensure timely acquisition of Management Information System (MIS) reports. Key Responsibilities: 1. Administrative Support: Manage the MD's calendar, appointments, and travel arrangements. Prepare and organize documents, presentations, and reports for meetings. Coordinate logistics for executive meetings, conferences, and events. Handle incoming communications, including emails, calls, and correspondence. 2. Being the Middle Person: Be the main contact between the MD and other people inside and outside the company. Make sure messages get through to the right people and get answers back to the MD. 3. Getting Reports: Collaborate with HODs to gather necessary data and reports for the MIS. Ensure accurate and timely submission of MIS reports from respective departments. Compile and analyze MIS data to generate insights and support decision-making processes. Prepare and present MIS reports to the MD and executive team as needed. 4. Project Coordination: Support special projects and initiatives as assigned by the MD. Coordinate cross-functional teams and track project milestones and deliverables. Assist in researching and gathering information for strategic planning and business development efforts. Requirements: Have experience as an assistant or in a similar role. Be really good at talking and writing clearly. Know your way around Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook). Be great at keeping things organized and getting stuff done on time. Be friendly and able to work well with different people. Nice to Have: Have some experience managing projects. Understand the business world and how things work in our industry.

column2: Executive Assistant is an administrative position managing the office of the Chancellor and serving as the liaison between his office and the various constituents of the University       The primary responsibility is to ensure that there is adequate coverage of the office on various aspects at all times while managing administrative and strategic priorities     These need to be professionally project managed through effective coordination, communication and execution in a timely efficient way                Responsibilities:                Be an integral team member of the Chancellor s Office in providing assistance and support in executing, managing, successfully implementing and ensuring the completion of the University wide strategic projects, new initiatives and operational activities.                     Provides confidential administrative support to Chancellor including but not limited to preparation of correspondence, attending to calls, organising the calendar, liaising with internal external stakeholders especially board members etc.                     Manage review filing both electronic and paper files, manage office systems, prepare presentations, minutes of meetings and reports under the guidance of Chancellor.                     Make arrangements for appointments, meeting and coordinate for the same from end to end.                     Taking briefs and directions from Chancellor to manage his priorities and executing efficient and effective service delivery.                     Organize travel and prepare travel itineraries, and related logistics.                     Able to plan, organize and manage events.                     Relieves the Chancellor of operational details by planning and coordinating the implementation of academic or administrative policies and decisions.                     Exercises initiative and independent judgment in the daily activities of the office, and manages the staff in the office of the Chancellor.                     Safeguards the confidentiality of University administration by exercising tact and discretion in communicating information to faculty, students, staff, and the various publics served by the University and in handling administrative records, files, and similar confidential items.                       Providing ongoing analyses of institutional planning efforts and conducting or overseeing special initiatives as needed to ensure that the Chancellor s objectives and the University s priorities are administered at the highest level with timely and accurate completion.                         Key Skills:               Relevant and considerable experience to support positions at the top management/senior level with grace, patience and sophistication.                     Intelligent, seasoned and mature individual with strong background and experience of an Executive Assistant.                     Discreet and able to manage a contemporary technology-driven office.                     Have an eye for detail, multi tasker with great follow-up skills.                     Highly organised and proactive, able to think independently and act efficiently.                     Extremely polished and professional written verbal communication skills.                     Ability to take charge of activities in collaboration with various stakeholders and execute tasks effectively.                     Facility with software and building databases and scalable administration systems.                     Possess strong interpersonal and human skills.                     Ability to learn within a new and dynamic organisation.                   Qualification:                 Graduate / Post graduate with preference given to candidates with Corporate Secretary-ship background.

column2: The Administrative Officer plays a vital role in providing administrative support and assisting with various human resources functions within a manufacturing company      This position requires a strong understanding of processes, excellent organizational skills, and the ability to maintain confidentiality      The Administrative Officer will work closely with the HR team and manufacturing personnel to ensure efficient operations and compliance with policies and procedures              Key Responsibilities:          Documentation and record-keeping: Assist in maintaining accurate and up-to-date employee records, including personnel files, benefits information, and performance evaluations. Ensure compliance with record-keeping requirements and handle sensitive and confidential information with discretion.          Employee benefits administration: Assist in administering employee benefits programs, such as health insurance, retirement plans, and other company-provided benefits. Answer employee inquiries regarding benefits, facilitate enrollment processes, and maintain accurate benefits records.          Time and attendance management: Support the time and attendance tracking process, including maintaining attendance records, tracking vacation and sick leave, and processing time-off requests. Collaborate with supervisors and employees to ensure accurate timekeeping and adherence to company policies          Policy and procedure support: Assist in the implementation and communication of policies and procedures within the manufacturing company. Update employee handbooks, distribute policy updates, and ensure employees understanding and compliance with HR guidelines.          Employee relations: Provide administrative support in employee relations matters, including documenting employee complaints, investigations, and disciplinary actions. Assist in organizing employee recognition programs and employee engagement initiatives.          Training and development coordination: Support the coordination of training programs, workshops, and seminars for employees. Assist in maintaining training records, tracking employee development plans, and scheduling training sessions.          Reporting: Assist in generating HR reports, metrics, and analytics, such as turnover rates, headcount reports, and HR-related data. Contribute to data analysis and provide recommendations for improving HR processes and practices.          Compliance and legal requirements: Stay up to date with relevant employment laws, regulations, and industry trends. Assist in ensuring compliance with labor laws, safety regulations, and other legal requirements within the manufacturing environment.          Qualifications and Skills:          Bachelors degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field is preferred. Relevant certifications or coursework in HR administration is a plus.          Proven experience in an administrative role, preferably within an HR department or manufacturing environment.          Strong understanding of HR processes, policies, and procedures.          Excellent organizational skills with attention to detail and ability to manage multiple priorities.          Proficient in using HRIS software, Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint), and other relevant applications.          Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to effectively interact with employees at all levels.          Demonstrated ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information with discretion.          Knowledge of employment laws, regulations, and compliance requirements in the manufacturing industry.          Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work both independently and collaboratively within a team

column2: As a Community Associate, you'll work closely with new and existing customers, solving problems for them and making sure they have everything they need.           A typical day at Regus         You arrive 15 minutes before your centre opens to make sure everything is ready and check there s nothing the cleaners have missed.     Customers start coming in thick and fast. One asks you for a changed WiFi code. Another wants to know if his important package has arrived. A woman needs directions to her meeting room and can you help her set up the projector and take an order for drinks?     The mail arrives. You sort through it while dealing with a whole host of other customer requests, remembering to email the customer from earlier to let him know his package is waiting for him in his mailbox. And that s lunch.     Early afternoon, you sit down with the Community Manager to discuss the organisation of next week s networking event. You plan and write the invites to customers, then create, print and put up posters on the noticeboards around the centre.     The day is coming to a close. Time to gently ask the large group in meeting room 3 to start wrapping up. You direct them to the nice restaurant you know around the corner, so they can grab a bite and continue their discussion. Once the last person has left the building and everything s nice and tidy, it s time to head home.             About you       We're looking for someone who knows how to manage multiple tasks while providing customers with the best possible service.        You also need to be:         A good communicator, with the ability to build strong professional relationships and empathise with people s needs     Happy taking ownership of problems and finding ways to solve them     Positive, enthusiastic and able to adapt to fast-changing situations     Confident using MS Office and other basic IT packages             What we offer         On top of a competitive salary package you'll enjoy:         A bright and inspiring work environment     Training and development opportunities
column11: Printing, Head Business Development, Networking, Packaging, Training and Development, Management, MS Office, WiFi

column2: Fortis Healthcare Ltd is looking for Call Centre Assistant to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey      As a Call Centre Assistant, you will play a crucial role in supporting the operations of the call centre by providing exceptional customer service and administrative assistance      Your responsibilities will include handling inbound and outbound calls, addressing customer inquiries and concerns, and maintaining accurate records of interactions      Additionally, you will assist with administrative tasks to ensure the smooth functioning of the call centre and contribute to the overall efficiency and effectiveness of the customer service operations        Key Responsibilities:        Customer Service: Handle incoming calls from customers, providing timely and accurate information, addressing inquiries, resolving issues, and ensuring high levels of customer satisfaction      Call Management: Make outbound calls to customers for various purposes, such as follow-ups, surveys, appointment scheduling, and service reminders, adhering to established scripts and protocols      Documentation: Maintain detailed and accurate records of customer interactions, including call logs, notes, and action taken, using call centre software or customer relationship management (CRM) systems      Administrative Support: Assist with administrative tasks, such as data entry, filing, scanning, and updating customer information in databases, to support the smooth functioning of the call centre operations      Quality Assurance: Adhere to quality standards and service level agreements (SLAs) for call handling, ensuring compliance with policies, procedures, and regulatory requirements      Problem Resolution: Troubleshoot customer issues and escalate complex or unresolved issues to appropriate personnel, such as supervisors or technical support teams, to ensure prompt resolution and customer satisfaction      Team Collaboration: Collaborate with colleagues and supervisors to share information, best practices, and feedback, contributing to a positive and cohesive team environment      Product Knowledge: Stay informed about products, services, promotions, and company policies to provide accurate and up-to-date information to customers and address their needs effectively      Communication Skills: Communicate professionally and effectively with customers, demonstrating active listening, empathy, and clear verbal communication skills to build rapport and trust      Adaptability: Adapt to changing priorities, workload fluctuations, and customer demands in a fast-paced and dynamic call centre environment, maintaining composure and professionalism under pressure

Fortnightly meeting with the district teams to understand the expenses incurred by the teams for activities, travel and any other expenses. Manage all cost-sharing activities, monthly verification with the district teams and timely reporting to the Central team in Delhi. Prepare quarterly budget for the districts and State in coordination with team members. We are dedicated, open-access partners with a commitment to excellence in delivering services across Data & Analytics, Capital Markets, and Post Trade.  Backed by three hundred years of experience, innovative technologies, and a team of over 23,000 people in 70 countries, our purpose is driving financial stability, empowering economies, and enabling customers to create sustainable growth.  Working in partnership with  Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) , we are excited to expand our  tech centres of excellence  in India, by building a new  global centre , right here in the heart of Hyderabad. We are passionate about our work, inspired by the impact it has on our business and our customers. As a team, we believe in winning as one collaborating to reach shared goals and developing through challenging and meaningful experiences.  As a global business we rely on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under country or local law. Thomson Reuters is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer providing a drug-free workplace. Intrigued by a challenge as large and fascinating as the world itself? Come join us. To learn more about what we offer, please visit thomsonreuters.com/careers. More information about Thomson Reuters can be found on thomsonreuters.com. Thomson Reuters is the leading source of intelligent information for the worlds businesses and professionals. We combine industry expertise with innovative technology to deliver critical information to leading decision makers in the financial and risk, legal, tax and accounting and media markets, powered by the worlds most trusted news organization. column2: System Management: The super administrator is responsible for managing and overseeing the entire system, including configuring, updating, and maintaining its components     User Management: They can create, modify, or delete user accounts and assign or revoke permissions as needed     Security: Ensuring the highest level of security is one of their primary responsibilities     This includes configuring firewalls, intrusion detection systems, and other security measures     System Configuration: Super administrators configure system settings, customize options, and set parameters to optimize system performance     Troubleshooting: They are often the first point of contact for resolving system issues, diagnosing problems, and implementing solutions     Data Backup and Recovery: Responsible for establishing and managing data backup and recovery procedures to prevent data loss     Updates and Patches: Ensuring that the system is up to date with the latest software updates, security patches, and bug fixes     Monitoring and Logging: Keeping an eye on system logs, monitoring performance, and addressing any irregularities or issues that may arise     User Support: Providing support and assistance to other users and administrators when needed

column2: Ivanti/ITSM Administrator Position Summary: We are seeking an ITSM knowledgeable Ivanti admin to help us continue our journey of support operations transformation. In Q2 2023 Pivotree will launch Ivanti Neurons as our customer facing ticketing system as we transform our customer service enterprise.  You are well-organized and self-motivated, comfortable working in a fast-paced environment, with diverse world-wide remote teams. You will also be supporting both the continued implementation of Ivanti technologies as well as migrating remaining services from Atlassian Jira Service Desk and Confluence.  The position is open in India. Roles & Responsibilities: Using your ITSM knowledge in an Ivanti Neurons ITSM system Create new workflows and services visible on the customer portal Experience implementing and building out Ivanti modules such as Product, Release, Security Implement an internal Pivotree portfolio to extend the tool to internal Service Management activities Build reports and dashboards for operational excellence Knowledgeable on the Atlassian toolset, specifically Jira, Jira Service Management, Confluence, Bamboo and OpsGenie Knowledgeable in automation platforms, specifically Workato to maintain existing workflows Use Ivanti Automation to improve the efficiency and usability of our ITSM system. Participate in occasional tool upgrades including pre and post testing conducted in the evenings Develop, test, and deploy integrations between Ivanti solutions and other internal systems Facilitate integration with external ticketing systems using Workato Keep up-to-date with Ivanti products and administration best practices Promote adoption and best practice of Ivanti suite across the user community Administer Confluence and help guide and maintain the organization of data in Confluence and ts migration to future Knowledge Management toolset Create and maintain technical documentation and user-guides including complex runbooks to ensure proper execution of work Train service desk agents and field questions on tool usage from internal staff and external clients Provide support for colleagues in using the tools mentioned Troubleshoot and debug access and performance problems Work with internal stakeholders to understand their requirements and design and implement solutions.   KEY SKILLS & COMPETENCIES: 3+ years of experience with Ivanti Neurons administration (managing periodic system updates of the tool is a plus) Experience with the Atlassian Jira Service Management and Confluence tools Ivanti Certifications desired Excellent verbal and written communications skills Strong troubleshooting and problem solving skills Able to manage and prioritize multiple concurrent tasks Other traits we look for : A professionally adaptable attitude A positive, people-oriented and energetic attitude An analytical, creative, and innovative approaches to solving problems An interest in working hard/being challenged in a fast-paced environment, and have fun while doing it

column2: Job Summary:  The AV Systems Administrator is responsible for the installation, maintenance, and troubleshooting of audio-visual (AV) systems in classrooms and lecture halls. This role ensures that all AV equipment functions smoothly to support effective teaching and learning experiences.  Key Responsibilities:   AV System Installation and Maintenance:   Install and configure AV systems including projectors, microphones, speakers, smart boards, and video conferencing equipment.  Perform regular maintenance checks to ensure all AV equipment is in good working order.  Upgrade AV systems as needed to keep up with technological advancements and institutional requirements.  Troubleshooting and Support:  Provide technical support for AV equipment during classes and events.  Quickly diagnose and resolve any AV system issues to minimize downtime.  Maintain a log of AV issues and resolutions to help prevent future problems.  User Training and Assistance:  Train faculty and staff on the proper use of AV equipment.  Create and update user manuals and quick-start guides for AV systems.  Assist users with setup and operation of AV equipment as needed.  System Monitoring and Management:  Monitor the performance and usage of AV systems to ensure optimal operation.  Implement and manage remote monitoring tools for AV equipment where applicable.  Maintain an inventory of AV equipment and manage asset tracking.  Coordination and Collaboration:  Work closely with the IT department to integrate AV systems with network infrastructure.  Collaborate with external vendors for AV system installations and repairs.  Coordinate with event organizers to understand and fulfill AV requirements for events and conferences.  Documentation and Reporting:  Maintain detailed records of all AV equipment, including installation dates, configurations, and maintenance schedules.  Generate reports on AV system performance and utilization.  Document all technical procedures and troubleshooting steps.  Qualifications:  Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Audio-Visual Technology, or a related field.  3+ years of experience in AV system installation, maintenance, and support.  Strong technical knowledge of AV systems, including projectors, sound systems, smart boards, and video conferencing equipment.  Excellent troubleshooting skills and the ability to resolve technical issues quickly.  Strong communication and interpersonal skills for training and assisting users.  Ability to work independently and as part of a team.  Certifications in AV technologies (such as CTS, Crestron, Extron) are a plus.  Key Competencies:  Technical proficiency in AV systems.  Strong problem-solving skills.  Excellent communication and training abilities.  Attention to detail.  Organizational and time management skills.  Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines. Location:  Hyderabad  Department:  IT

column2: Fortis Healthcare Ltd is looking for Supervisor Medical Administration to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey         Staff Management    : You supervise and lead a team of administrative staff, including medical secretaries, receptionists, medical records clerks, billing specialists, and administrative assistants. This involves hiring, training, scheduling, and performance management to ensure efficient operations and high-quality service delivery.              Patient Services    : You oversee patient services, ensuring that patients are greeted courteously, appointments are scheduled promptly, and inquiries are handled professionally. You may establish and enforce policies and procedures related to patient registration, check-in, check-out, and patient confidentiality.              Medical Records Management    : You are responsible for the maintenance, security, and confidentiality of medical records and health information. This includes ensuring compliance with regulations such as HIPAA (Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act) and implementing electronic health record (EHR) systems or other record management technologies.              Billing and Revenue Cycle Management    : You oversee billing processes, insurance verification, claims processing, and revenue cycle management to ensure accurate and timely reimbursement for healthcare services rendered. This involves collaborating with billing departments, payers, and third-party administrators to resolve billing discrepancies and optimize revenue capture.              Regulatory Compliance    : You ensure compliance with healthcare regulations, accreditation standards, and industry best practices in medical administration. This may involve maintaining up-to-date knowledge of regulatory requirements, conducting internal audits and assessments, and implementing corrective actions to address compliance issues.

column2: Hello  Candidate ,   Greetings from  Hungry Bird IT Consulting Services Pvt. Ltd !! We're hiring an  Executive Assistant  for our client. Summary:  The Executive Assistant provides comprehensive support to the CEO, ensuring smooth daily operations and efficient communication with internal and external stakeholders. This position requires a high level of discretion, professionalism, and the ability to handle sensitive information with confidentiality. Qualification : Bachelor's degree in business administration, communication, or a related field. Location : Hyderabad Experience : Minimum 5 to 8 Years Work type : Work from office   Roles and responsibilities: Manage the CEO's complex schedule, coordinating meetings, appointments, and travel arrangements. Prioritize and resolve scheduling conflicts. Draft, review, and edit correspondence on behalf of the CEO. Manage the email inbox and prioritize responses. Liaise with internal and external stakeholders, including board members, clients, and partners. Prepare agendas, collect and distribute materials, take minutes, and track action items for executive meetings and board meetings. Assist the CEO in managing special projects, research, and presentations. Coordinate and track progress on key initiatives. Manage travel logistics, including booking flights, accommodations, and ground transportation. Prepare expense reports and manage reimbursements. Maintain strict confidentiality of sensitive information and documents. Efficiently manage the CEO's schedule and maximize productivity. Ensure effective communication and collaboration with internal and external stakeholders. Provide accurate and timely support for projects and initiatives. Maintain confidentiality and professionalism in all interactions. A number of scheduling conflicts were resolved successfully. Timeliness and accuracy of meeting preparations. Satisfaction ratings from internal and external stakeholders. Number of successful project completions.   Desired candidate: Bachelor's degree in business administration, communication, or a related field. A minimum of 5 years of experience as an executive assistant or personal assistant to a senior executive. Excellent communication, interpersonal, and organizational skills. Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint). Ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously and prioritize effectively. Strong attention to detail and problem-solving skills. Prior experience in the construction industry would be preferred.   (Interested candidates can share their CV with us at  aradhana@hungrybird.in or reach us at 9959417171. )   PLEASE MENTION THE RELEVANT POSITION IN THE SUBJECT LINE OF THE EMAIL. column2: Greetings From Prochant India Pvt Ltd We are hiring for Admin Executive in Trivandrum Location. We are seeking a versatile and proactive Administrative Executive with knowledge of compliances, building infrastructures, HVAC  (Heating, Ventilation, and Air Conditioning) , Fire alarm systems, and Electricals, Facility , Asset and Vendor Management. Roles and Responsibilities: Ensure maintenance and upkeep of all facilities, including buildings, equipment, and utilities. Conduct regular inspections, identify maintenance needs, and coordinate repairs or replacements. Enforce health and safety standards to create a safe work environment. Oversee housekeeping staff and ensure cleanliness and tidiness of the office premises. Coordinate cleaning schedules and ensure compliance with hygiene standards. Handle incoming calls, emails, and correspondence, directing them to appropriate departments or individuals. Assist in preparing reports, presentations, and other communication materials. Evaluate vendors based on performance, quality, and cost-effectiveness. Negotiate contracts and agreements with vendors to ensure favourable terms. Coordinate travel arrangements for employees, including flight bookings, hotel accommodations, and transportation.  Manage hotel bookings and ensure accommodations meet organization's standards and budget. Monitor SLAs with vendors and service providers to ensure compliance. Address any issues or discrepancies in SLAs and work towards resolution. Maintain records of company assets and equipment, track usage, and conduct regular audits. Assist in procurement of new assets as needed. Procure office supplies, equipment, and services as required. Manage inventory levels and conduct audits to ensure adequate stock levels. Handle incoming tickets or requests from employees and stakeholders, ensuring timely resolution. Arrange catering services for meetings, events, and employee meals. Collect feedback on food quality and service and make necessary adjustments. Oversee the management of Management Information Systems (MIS) to ensure accurate and timely reporting of data. Generate reports and analyze data to provide insights for decision-making and process improvement. Facilitate onboarding process for new employees, includes printing ID Card, Access Card, conducting orientations, and coordinating with relevant departments. Manage offboarding process for departing employees, including exits, asset retrieval, and clearance procedures. Key Competencies Deep and thorough understanding of Prochant policies and procedures. Exceptional verbal, interpersonal, and written communication skills Organized, detail-oriented and self-motivated. Ability to juggle multiple responsibilities. Professional presentation skills and confidence when speaking. Exceptional problem-solving skills to analyze issues and identify potential liabilities. Strong leadership skills to promote personal and professional development and teamwork. Ability to maintain strong professional relationships with internal teams and management. Consistent demonstration of a professional, positive attitude. A strong, working understanding of computers and an ability to self-troubleshoot simple issues. column1: Hospital Manager at Nirali A M Naik Charitable Health-Care Facility
column2: Job Summary: The Hospital Manager will be responsible for overseeing the day-to-day operations of the 25-bed hospital, ensuring high standards of patient care, staff efficiency, and effective management of resources. The role involves strategic planning, budget control, coordination of services, and ensuring compliance with healthcare regulations. Key Responsibilities: Operational Management: Oversee daily operations:  Ensure smooth functioning of all departments including outpatient,     inpatient, emergency, and support services. Resource management:  Efficiently manage hospital resources including staffing, equipment, and supplies. Quality assurance:  Implement and maintain quality standards in patient care and hospital      services. Facility maintenance:  Ensure the hospital is well-maintained, safe, and clean for patients,    visitors, and staff. Financial Management: Budgeting:  Develop and manage the hospital budget, ensuring financial sustainability and accountability. Cost control:  Monitor expenses and implement cost-saving measures without compromising      on quality of care. Revenue cycle management:  Oversee billing, coding, and collections processes to ensure accurate and timely revenue generation. Human Resource Management: Staff recruitment and training:  Recruit, train, and retain qualified medical and non-medical staff. Performance management:  Conduct performance evaluations, provide feedback, and foster professional development. Patient Care: Patient satisfaction:  Monitor patient feedback and implement strategies to enhance patient      satisfaction and experience. Patient safety:  Ensure all safety protocols are followed to provide a safe environment for      patients and staff. Compliance and Regulatory Affairs: Regulatory compliance:  Ensure the hospital complies with all local, state, and national      healthcare regulations. Accreditation:  Maintain and pursue necessary accreditations and certifications. Policy development:  Develop and implement hospital policies and procedures in line with best practices and regulatory requirements. Strategic Planning: Long-term planning:  Develop strategic plans to enhance hospital services, expand patient base, and improve operational efficiency. Community engagement:  Build and maintain relationships with community leaders, organizations, and stakeholders. Market analysis:  Conduct market research to identify opportunities for growth and      improvement. Qualifications: Education:  Bachelor's or Master's degree or a post graduate diploma in Hospital Administration, Healthcare Management or Business Administration  Experience:  Minimum of 3 to7 years of experience in a health care facility, preferably in a similar setting. Key Skills & Competencies: Strong leadership and interpersonal skills. Excellent communication and organizational abilities. Financial acumen and experience in budget management. Knowledge of healthcare regulations and compliance. Ability to handle stressful situations and make decisions under pressure Reporting: Reports to the Chief Medical Officer and Hospital Management Committee.
column11: Hospital Administration, Hospital Management

column1: Senior Associate Manager  School of Human Development
column2: About the   School of Human Development The School of Human Development (SHD) at IIHS focuses on social transformation. The School understands social transformation as a set of processes that are rooted in, and seek to directly address: Inequality in social status and substantive rights based on identity; The absence of material and economic dignity for the urban majority; and Inequities in political presence, recognition and participation. The Schools core focus areas are: decent work, affordable housing, social inequality, social protection, urban health, and community mobilisation. Job Description The Senior Associate / Manager  SHD Office will be part of a small, core team which will assist in building out the School over the coming years. The core responsibility of this position will be to assist in the development and implementation of the Schools strategy. The incumbent will support governance, strategic and operational planning, the management of resources (people, physical and financial), development and delivery of the academic courses, external engagement, relationship building with key partners and collaborators, and knowledge management and outreach. S/he will act as one of the primary links between SHD and various programmes, labs, and other schools at IIHS. Along with individual faculty and other team members, s/he will need to ensure coordination and timely delivery of outcomes. Activities and Tasks Responsibilities would include, but not be limited to, the following: Strategy and Planning: Supporting operational and strategic planning, governance, budgeting, resource management and personnel planning; Coordinating various initiatives of the School, including overall programme management as well as budgeting; Planning, overseeing and implementing school-wide systems and processes for activities as needed; Generating business development strategies (including periodic updates on the market landscape), and identifying opportunities and initiatives in partnership with faculty / staff and in line with the strategic objectives of the School; Designing, commissioning/conducting research on domains related to the school, as well as preparing briefing and information papers; Relationship Management and Communications: Assisting in the development and management of external relationships and collaboration opportunities with key domestic and international partners, and collaborators; Ensuring effective communication across the School and with the wider institution, and positive working relations with other schools and programmes; Representing the School on committees or other forums, where required, and advocating for the interests of the School as with those of the institution; Collaboration with the communication and design team, developing and supporting in execution of communication strategy; Operations: Assisting in setting up and ensuring continuous improvement in the infrastructure, and administrative systems and procedures for the School?? activities; Managing the interface among various programmes, labs, schools, administration, procurement, finance and legal; Monitoring resources, processes and deliverables of projects delivered by the programmes within the School; Supporting and coordinating the development and delivery of specialised degree / diploma programmes including preparatory activities, content delivery, internships and placements, stakeholder management, and reporting; Managing and monitoring recruitment, staff progress, and learning and development for the School in consultation with the Associate Deans and the People Function; Assisting in regular reporting to the Associate Dean on key milestones and highlighting critical concerns and risks; Coordinating the preparation of the School?? Annual Report and contributing towards the preparation of the institution?? Annual Report; Providing support to other IIHS activities including academics, research, training, practice, operations and others; Participating in all activities of institution building at IIHS; carrying out tasks as assigned by IIHS; and travelling on IIHS work within or outside the country as and when needed. Structure and Reporting The Senior Associate / Manager will report to the Associate Dean ??School of Human Development at IIHS and will be required to collaborate effectively with a diverse group of internal teams and external individuals/organizations, and students. Person Specification The applicant should have: A Master?? degree in a relevant field including but not limited to Planning/ Public Policy/ Public Administration/ Management/ Social Work/ or across the Social Sciences and Humanities, or a related field; A total of 5 to 8 years of administrative or management experience, ideally in the urban or development sector; Prior experience in academic management and administration or a similar domain is preferred, or strong experience in programme management; Experience of working in inter-disciplinary teams, preferably across practice and research; Strong writing, analytical and numerical skills; A high level of organisational capability, including the ability to establish and maintain effective systems, procedures and processes and manage competing demands and deadlines without compromising quality; A high level of communication and interpersonal skills, including the ability to consult and collaborate with inter-disciplinary and diverse teams; analyse and present information and produce well researched high-quality reports, submissions, and other documents; negotiate complex issues and manage change; The ability to think strategically, contribute effectively to strategic planning processes and to operationalise strategy with the administrative operations of the School; Effective working knowledge of at least one Indian language. This offer is on an exclusive basis, which implies that other professional assignments (whether compensated or not) that bear a potential conflict of interest with IIHS cannot be undertaken. The search will remain open until the position is filled. Location This position is based in Bengaluru and may entail travel to other locations in India. Review and Assessment The role and performance of the incumbent shall be subject to normal review and assessment systems at IIHS. Diversity Policy IIHS is an equal opportunity employer that encourages women, people with disabilities and those from economically and socially excluded communities with the requisite skills and qualifications to apply for positions. Contact Please write to us at  hr@iihs.co.in  if you need any clarifications while filling the online application form.

column2: VACANCY FOR WARDEN (MALE)  SGT University (NAAC A+ Grade Accredited),  in its campus spread over 70 acres near Gurgaon, offers around 160+ programmes in Medical and Non-Medical domains. It nurtures more than seven thousand students and is a hub of activities involving the nations whos who. It is a part of a group spanning the fields of education and hospitality. The University employs close to three thousand people. The campus has accommodation for employees and hostels for students and offers excellent support facilities such as shopping complex, medical facilities, sports, entertainment, and transportation. The campus is located less than 5 km from the Delhi border of Daurala and offers convenient access to Indira Gandhi International Airport, Delhi.   Name of the Post :  Warden (Male) No. of vacancies : Two Age : 35 to 50 years Salary Range  :  Rs. 25,000/- pm to Rs. 35,000 pm   Qualification & Experience   Graduate, Experience with Academic Institutions or Universities will be preferred. Good Communication Skills, Good Command over English language  Knowledge of Ms Office. Minimum 5 years of experience as a warden.   Duties/Responsibilities: Responsible for overall functioning of the hostel. Responsible for allotment of rooms to the hostellers. Responsible for maintenance of all the records and documents related to the hostel.  Responsible for proper inventory management of hostel premises. Responsible for maintenance of proper hygiene, sanitation and cleanliness of the hostel premises with the help of assistant warden.  Responsible for providing records of non-usable/damaged items to Senior Warden. Responsible for enforcing discipline and decorum in the dining hall. Responsible for looking after the quality of food served in the hostels. Responsible for periodic audit/physical verification of hostel inventory and occupancy in coordination with Assistant Warden. Responsible for maintenance of strict discipline among hostellers. Responsible for maintenance of the proper internal control system in the hostel premises. Report any indiscipline or misbehaviour by the students to the Senior Warden/ Assistant Chief Warden. Make recommendations to the Senior Warden for any improvement in the hostel operations. Responsible for enforcing strict ban on unauthorized guest entry in the hostel premises and dining halls. Coordination with the accounts department to reconcile the hostel dues and receipts in a timely manner. Address the grievances/complaints of the hosteller promptly.  Responsible for issuance of gate passes to hostellers and monitor their check in and check out. All unresolved disciplinary matters to be forwarded to the concerned authorities.  Ensure proper arrangement of First Aid kit in the hostel for any health-related emergencies. Responsible for indenting inventory on ERP and collecting from stores as per requirement. Responsible for proper implementation of university policies and guidelines. Ensure all the vacant rooms are locked and not mis utilised by hostellers.  Responsible for marking  attendance of hostellers both in the morning and at night. Per circumstances, perform any other responsibility in sync with your position as assigned by the competent authority.    How to apply: Candidates are required to visit the careers web page https://sgtuniversity.ac.in/careers/  and apply online or apply by Registered Post to the following Address: HR Department (Non-Teaching) SGT University (Shree Guru Gobind Singh Tricentenary University) Gurgaon-Badli Road, Budhera,  Gurugram, Haryana 122505 The last date of submission of online applications is 28th February 2024. No TA/DA will be paid by the SGT University for attending the interview/test.    General Conditions: The University shall process the applications entirely on the basis of information/ documents submitted by the candidates. In case the information/documents are found to be false/ incorrect by way of omission or commission, the responsibility and liability shall lie solely with the candidate. All appointments shall be made provisionally subject to verification of certificates. The University shall verify the documents and antecedents of the applicant at the time of test/interview/joining or at any stage during the period of service. In case, it is found at any point of time that any document/ information submitted by the applicant is false or the applicant has suppressed/concealed any relevant information, the services of the selected applicant shall be terminated forthwith without assigning any reason. The University may also initiate appropriate action under the provisions of Indian Panel Code,1860 for production of false information. All correspondence from the University including test/interview letter, if any, shall be sent only at the e-mail address provided by the applicant in the application form. The applicants are advised to check the website of the University regularly for updates. The University reserves the right to revise/ reschedule/ cancel/ suspend/ withdraw the recruitment process in part or full without assigning any reason. The decision of the University shall be final and no appeal in this regard shall be entertained. The posts advertised are tentative. The University reserves the right not to fill up the vacancy as advertised, if the circumstances so warrant. Vacancies may increase or decrease. In case of any inadvertent mistake in the process of selection, which may be detected at any stage even after issuing an appointment letter, the University reserves the right to modify/ withdraw/ cancel any communication made to the applicant in this regard. In case of any dispute/ ambiguity that may occur in the process of selection, the decision of the University shall be final. Candidates should possess the essential qualifications as on the closing date of application. Working knowledge of latest computer applications and good communication skills are mandatory for all positions and the University reserves its right to test the skill of a candidate at the time of selection. Mere fulfilling the minimum educational qualification and experience shall not entitle a candidate to be necessarily called for the test/interview. Applicants who do not meet the qualifications given in this advertisement and/or incomplete applications will be rejected summarily.  Canvassing in any form will lead to disqualification.       Phone: 0124-2278183-85; Fax: 0124-2278151 Website: sgtuniversity.ac.in Email:career.nt@sgtuniversity.ac.in   Budhera, Gurugram-Badli road, Gurugram (Haryana)-122505.   _________________________________________________________________________________________

column2: Single point of contact in Patient journey from Admissions to discharge. Responsible for the ongoing activities on the floor. Patient's round on daily basis (Meeting and greetings each and every patient admitted on their assigned floors twice in a day). Patient orientation-brief introduction and sharing their contact number. Follow up with TL (Nursing- Team Leader) regarding the diagnostic tests that have to be facilitated. Negative feedbacks to be shared with the Service Excellence department for logging. Work towards enhancing the patient experience. Sorting the complaints / concerns of the floors inter or intra department. Supervision on support staff (House Keeping, GDA's, F&B etc.) in order to obtain TAT(Turn Around Time). Briefing / Coordination to be done within the team with other support departments-supervisors and executives in order to smoothen the process / services. Tracker to be maintained for daily Hospital rounds. Discharge leaflets to be distributed to the planned discharge patients during evening hours and traction of total discharges. Information dissemination to the attendant as well as patient regarding discharge process a day before the discharge is planned. Follow up with the floor doctors/ coordinators/ Nursing regarding discharge summary preparation. Emphasize on discharge time i.e. 11 AM (for Cash, PSU and other corporate tie-ups). Coordinate with the nursing staff and discharge coordinators to expedite the discharge process.

column2: Gegadyne Energy is a leading company in the renewable energy sector, dedicated to creating innovative and sustainable energy solutions. We are currently seeking a Front Office Associate cum Executive Assistant to join our team. This role includes a combination of front office administration responsibilities and providing support to the executive team. As the Front Office Administrator, you will be responsible for maintaining a professional atmosphere in the reception area, greeting and assisting visitors, answering phone calls, and managing office supplies. Additionally, you will support the executive team as an Executive Assistant by managing calendars, scheduling appointments, preparing documents, and handling confidential information. Role & responsibilities: Manage the front desk and serve as the first point of contact for visitors. Greet and direct visitors in a professional and friendly manner. Answer and forward phone calls, take messages as necessary. Manage the CEO's calendar and coordinate appointments and meetings. Prepare and edit correspondence, communications, presentations, and other documents. Conduct research, compile data, and prepare reports for the CEO. Coordinate travel arrangements, including flights, hotels, and ground transportation. Process expenses and maintain accurate and up-to-date records. Maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information with discretion. Handle incoming and outgoing mail and packages. Maintain office supplies and place orders when necessary. Assist with scheduling appointments and managing calendars. Keep the reception area clean and organized. Perform other administrative tasks as assigned. Preferred candidate profile   Bachelor's degree in business, communications, or a related field. 4+ years of experience as a front office cum EA or in a similar support role. Excellent organizational and time-management skills. Strong written and verbal communication skills. Ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously and prioritize effectively. Strong attention to detail and ability to maintain confidentiality.

column2: Job Description Role - Executive Assistant Notice period - Immediate Mode - Contract The Surface team is looking for an experienced, resourceful and highly motivated individual to provide business administrative support to a large team. This position requires stellar interpersonal skills, initiative, good judgment, and common sense, as well as the ability to maintain confidentiality, set priorities and handle multiple tasks simultaneously. We are a friendly, hard-working, and growing team looking for the right fit. The ideal candidate should have a strong customer service approach, should be organized, and be self-directed. column2: Executive Assistant JOB   TITLE   :  Executive Assistant to Country Director JOB   TYPE   :  Full time LOCATION   :  Bangalore WHO   WE   ARE Noora Healths mission is to improve outcomes and strengthen health systems by equipping family caregivers with the skills they need to care for their loved ones. Founded in 2014, Noora Health turns hospital hallways and waiting rooms into classrooms by tapping into the most compassionate resources available for the patients care: their own family. With support from governments and partners in India, Bangladesh, and Indonesia, Noora Health has trained more than three million caregivers across 400+ facilities using their flagship caregiver education and training curriculum, the Care Companion Program (CCP). In a cohort of patients, the CCP reduced post-surgical cardiac complications by 71%, maternal complications by 12%, newborn complications by 16%, and newborn readmissions by 56%. Noora Health was honored as a TED 2022 Audacious Project Grantee and recipient of the  2022 Skoll Foundation Award for Social Innovation. Featuring Edith Elliott and Shahed Alam, our Co-Founders and Co-CEOs, Noora Healths mission took the spotlight at TED 2022 and was also featured in a 2022 Skoll video. WHAT   YOU   WILL   DO  Manage executive?? calendar; schedule large volumes of internal and external meetings across various time zones. www.noorahealth.org   Build and enforce structure into calendars; proactively monitor to ensure there are no conflicts and overall adherence to the established scheduling standards.  Coordinate extensive business travel with detailed itineraries and travel logistics following all government regulations and safety protocols; make reservations as requested and be available to triage any issues as they arise.  Screen and evaluate incoming calls/mail and report sensitive information in a timely manner.  Track and submit all expenses and manage purchase order deadlines.  Maintain a thorough understanding of Noora Health?? goals and the priorities/challenges of the Executive team; leverage business context to drive strategy around meeting cadences, formats and information flow for the Executive team.  Coordinate logistics for events, providing onsite support when needed (including some offsites, industry events, conferences with some travel required).  Coordinate with communications and content business team to ensure executive is prepped for presentations and external speaking engagements, including onsite assistance for presentations like All Hands and Team retreats.  Provide support on any special research or planning projects.  Ensure general inquiries to the executive are responded to and proper follow-ups are executed in a timely manner.  Handle sensitive information with good judgment, discretion, and absolute confidentiality.  Assist Country Director with preparation for meetings, including help with putting together decks or pre-reads for meetings, drafts emails and other communications.  Provide meeting support to Noora Health?? Leadership Team, creating and reviewing agendas prior to meetings, taking notes and distributing meeting minutes and presentations. Track action items and communicate status. Ensure meetings flow smoothly.  Provide end-to-end support to our Country Director; relieving her of all administrative details, projects and workflows.  Support the maintenance of knowledge management assets.  Establish new??nd improve existing??dministrative systems and processes. WHO   ARE   WE   LOOKING   FOR  Bachelor?? degree required.  5+ years of administrative experience reporting directly to upper management, preferably with working knowledge of the non-profit sector.  Exceptional communication skills, including excellent written and verbal communication (English; Hindi a plus.)  Incredible eye for detail, with master-level organizational and time management skills.  Ability to work effectively both collaboratively and independently.  Demonstrated experience managing calendars and travel logistics.  Experience working with tech and tools such as Google Suite, Slack, Google Calendar.  Adaptable, empathetic team player willing to do what it takes to get the job done. WHAT   WE   VALUE At Noora Health, we value diversity, equity, and inclusion, and we understand the value of developing a team with different perspectives, educational backgrounds, and life experiences. We prioritize diversity within our team, and we welcome candidates from all gender identities, castes, religious practices, sexual orientations, and abilities ??among many others. Professionals with field level experience of public health management are encouraged to apply. www.noorahealth.org
